## load() function

Load certificates from files and watch for changes.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function load<T extends Record<string, string>>(certFiles: T, cb: (err: Error | null, certs: {
    [key in keyof T]: Buffer;
} | null) => void, opts?: LoadCertsOptions): void;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  certFiles | T | Object with paths to certificate files. |
|  cb | (err: Error \| null, certs: { \[key in keyof T\]: Buffer; } \| null) =&gt; void | Callback to call when certificates are loaded or changed. If some certificates fail loading, or timeout has elapsed, cb will be called with null. |
|  opts | [LoadCertsOptions](./update-certs.loadcertsoptions.md) | <i>(Optional)</i> Options. |

<b>Returns:</b>

void

## Example


```ts
import { load } from "certs-watch";
load({
   key: "/path/to/key.pem",
   cert: "/path/to/cert.pem",
   ca: "/path/to/ca.pem"
 }, (err, certs) => {
   if (err) {
      console.error(err);
      return;
    }
   if (certs) {
     console.log("Certificates loaded");
   }
})
```
